TopicTitle: What do you think the Mystery goo really is ?

Articles.Content:
Fourth Grader mode:

YOUR MOM!

Let's not be ageist.
It's the remains of forum members who keep asking when the next version will be released.
U can find green goo on launch pad, guess the rest...
{Plant origin theory} Maybe it is what Kerbals are made of before they spore/pod....
Expired Rocket Fuel? I mean, studying it will lead to new developments.
Thankfully it isn't Grey Goo.

I have worked it out to one of two things....

Its either Starbucks coffee....

or...

Ghost Busters ectoplasm...
Let's just say it had to do with bob, trash cans and rockets.

probably some secretion from the kerbal exocrine glands..

maybe semen, maybe snot, maybe sweat, who knows.

My 2nd Mun mission in .22 has just revealed some interesting information about the "Goo."

Rodson Kerman was climbing down to become the fourth Kerbal on another world. However, as he passed the Goo containers, he suddenly was pulled into the service module, right next to the Goo. Rodson immediately suffered severe muscle spasms, causing him to be abruptly thrown to the ground... along with two of the containers! On live television! The other two pilots reported that the whole ship "shuddered violently for at least 3 seconds." Once Rodson got back up, he kicked one of the containers for ruining his "big moment." The crazy thing exploded in a fire ball that engulfed the entire lander...

My top scientists say that the Goo is "extremely unstable", and that all personnel should keep a save distance from the containers at all times.
I have to say it is the squid / octopus offspering thing we saw in the trailer. Open the goo container in the water and it says, "The goo escapes into the water"

Cleverbot confirms

User: Hey Cleverbot, do you know what the Mystery Goo in Kerbal Space program is made of?

Cleverbot: You don't know what your own name is?

User: No, I know what my name is, but what is the so-called 'Mystery Goo' in KSP made of?

Cleverbot: What is your name?

User: Xzxvrx.

Cleverbot: A random number from 1 to 4.

User: 2.

Cleverbot: I knew you would pick that number.

User: What does it have to do with what the goo is made of?

Cleverbot: It just does.

User: Then what is it?

Cleverbot: Mushroom Kingdom.

User: Wrong game. I'm talking about Kerbal Space Program.

Cleverbot: I'm not a program, I'm a person I tell you.

User: Then tell me what the Goo is made of!

Cleverbot: I don't know what to say.

User: Yes you do! What is the Mystery Goo!

Cleverbot: I don't know. You tell me.

User: No, I am asking you because I don't know. You should know because you knew what Minimus is made of.

Cleverbot: I'm a human.

User: Then go play KSP and figure out what the Goo is!

Cleverbot: Are you a girl?

User: Thats not important. Just tell my what the Mystery Goo is made of.

Cleverbot: What should he do about it?

User: YOU should tell me about the Mystery Goo.

Cleverbot: I know about women.

User: Sure you do, now please; tell my what the goo is.

Cleverbot: I've never felt it.

User: But you still know what it is right?

Cleverbot: XD is a face.

User: That may be. Just tell me the answer.

Cleverbot: I don't know the answer.

User: Yes you do. It is attracted to water, it freezes at high altitudes, it becomes less dense on the Mun and Minimus and it likes to be in High Kerbin Orbit.

Cleverbot: Wow, interesting.

User: Yes it is, take that and tell me what material does it.

Cleverbot: I don't know what I have as yet?

User: I already told you, just tell me what the Goo is made of!

Cleverbot: No you just told me that you did.

User: No I don't but you do.

Cleverbot: Do I?

User: Yes, what is it.

Cleverbot: I don't know honestly. I talked to you yesterday.

User: No I didn't. Im sure you know what it is made out of.

Cleverbot: Ok.

User: What is it!?

Cleverbot: Ask me about myself.

User: Do you know the composition of Mystery Goo?

Cleverbot: In the beginning, God created the Heavens and the Earth.

User: 'And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep.' Yes Yes Yes, they read it on Apollo 8 in orbit around the Moon.

Cleverbot: I'm not a believer.

User: Not a believer in knowing what Mystery Goo is?

Cleverbot: What are you?

User: Mystery Goo, what am I made of.

Cleverbot: Are you made of jello?

User: That is all I needed, thank you.

Cleverbot: *punches you in the face* lololololol.

Took some interrogation but I eventually got it.

Jello.
Possibly some Phlebotinum or Unobtainium, remember, any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from a completely ad-hoc plot device.
It's not that hard to figure out, the Mystery Goo is obviously Ã¢â€“Ë†Ã¢â€“Ë†Ã¢â€“Ë†Ã¢â€“Ë†Ã¢â€“Ë†.
Kraken soup.

IT'S PART OF JOOLS ATMOSPHERE!!!!

Or

ITS KETHANE!!!!!!

Or

Bill: um... Commander Jeb?

Jeb: yes?

Bill: the um, mystery goo has escaped.

Jeb: and?

Bill: ITS FORMING INTO THE KRAKEN AAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHERMAGERDAHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!

Jeb: FIRE THE SRBS!!!!!!

Well some games have an unusual material like XCOM has Elerium and C&C has tyberium maybe the goo in ksp is that vital plot element of a material.

So then it need a name... like KERBIDIUM,no no too generic... or Visciduim.Get it because its a viscous fluid or Limunium from the latin for slime,ah who am i kidding i have no ideas.

why dont you post your own sugjestion.
Since it is a mystery I think they are not using it to test conditions in space but to see what the heck it is. The Kerbals are just as confused by it as we are.
Its clearly a fungus found between the toes of jeb kerman!

This:

I think that was kinda obvious...

hahahaahah hilarious
I'm not sure I want to know what the goo is...

Kerbals = Humans

Goo = Apes and other primates.

So the Goo is the same was when we use to send monkeys and other animals into space.

Now we just have to watch out for KETG (Kerbals for the ethical treatment of Goo)
It's an alien life form, obviously, it is saying that the goo feel home while orbiting around minimus.

Am I the only one who thinks that the goo container eerily resembles the plot from 1988 horror movie The Blob? That was pretty much the first thing that came to my mind when I saw the description in the game.

A meteorite crashes near the town of Arborville, California; an elderly transient discovers, within the sphere, a jelly-like substance (the Blob) that attaches itself to his hand.

Later in the movie, even humans are trying to harvest some Science out of it...
